intro: Dryandra praemorsa var. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often recurved leaves. The plant produces striking, pink to red flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and native plant collections.
